overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, with a focus on research and announcements related to computational social science, disinformation, and coordinated inauthentic behavior. While LinkedIn boasts the largest follower count, engagement varies across platforms.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research projects, publications, and methodological approaches in computational social science.
Content focused on detecting, analyzing, and understanding disinformation campaigns and coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media.
Announcements for postdoctoral positions and research opportunities within Fabio Giglietto's team.
Posts related to upcoming conference presentations and participation in relevant events.

recommendations: Increase posting frequency on Mastodon to enhance visibility and engagement.
Experiment with visual content (images, videos) on all platforms to capture attention and boost engagement.
Engage directly with comments and questions to foster a sense of community and encourage interaction.
Tailor content to the specific audience on each platform to maximize relevance and impact.
Use relevant hashtags consistently to increase discoverability of content.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows a good balance of likes and reposts, indicating active engagement with the content. Focus on continuing to share research findings and opportunities here.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has the lowest engagement compared to other platforms. Experiment with different content formats and posting times to improve performance.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn demonstrates strong engagement through likes and comments, suggesting a professional audience interested in research grants and job opportunities. Continue to post professional updates here.
